item.title: Math joke
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:50, topic:365136”][quote author=justinxg27 link=topic=461339.msg3377017#msg3377017 date=1287698681]
See david. Can’t you go into a single topic these days without starting a pointless & stupid argument. It seems it’s also very often with jc aswell…
[/quote]It was more like a discussion about curriculum, which I admit was off-topic. The ‘argument’ started when he said that he thought I wouldn’t understand the joke.

And to be honest, that post you just made was off-topic and a potential argument starter too :P[/quote]

Yes, it was an argument. You continually retort to every single person who opposes you in any way, hence why people say all you do is argue. It’s not an opinion, it’s a fact. Frankly, your arguments are usually off-topic too, so I wouldn’t see you retaining your posting abilities for long on this forum if you continue them. It’s fine to share an opinion and defend it, but there’s a line and you shouldn’t be crossing it. The line is generally when the topic is being derailed or when personal attacks start coming out.

As for that math proof you posted, I think it’s a relation to 2 + 2 = 5, in which case the argument is you can’t divide by 0. Sorry for spoiling it, but the people above this post should be baffled for a while anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Math joke
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:45, topic:365136”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=461339.msg3376893#msg3376893 date=1287694330]
What the hell, Jc and Davidi2? Not to be rude, but who gives two shits if your guys ideas of how school curriculum should work don’t match? You are both spamming and being rather rude to those who actually look at this topic for its purpose: math jokes.

Speaking of them, the one Davidi2 brought up is my favorite to date, so I found it :P:

  1. “Girls require time and money”;

girls = time × money

  1. “Time is money”:

time = money

  1. So girls are money squared:

girls = money[sup]2[/sup]

  1. ”Money is the root of all evil”:

money =

  1. So, girls are evil:


[/quote]Sorry, he was just saying that I wouldn’t understand it, and then we got off-topic.

And yes, that is one of my favorites too

Here’s one:

We have two variables a and b. they are equal to eachother:

a = b - Two variables set equal to eachother
a + 5a = 5a + b - Add 5a to both sides
6a = 5a + b - Combine like terms
6a - 6b = 5a + b - 6b - Subtract 6b from each
6(a - b) = 5a + b - 6b - Factor
6(a - b) = 5a - 5b - Combine like terms
6(a - b) = 5(a - b) - Factor
6 = 5 - Divide by (a-b)

For the people that understand the basic logic, don’t ruin it for others![/quote]
I’m pretty sure the number needs to be positive on one side and negative on the other…

Read full topic

Speaking of them, the one Davidi2 brought up is my favorite to date, so I found it :P:

  1. “Girls require time and money”;

girls = time × money

time = money

  1. ”Money is the root of all evil”:

money =

  1. So, girls are evil:

[/quote]Sorry, he was just saying that I wouldn’t understand it, and then we got off-topic.

And yes, that is one of my favorites too

Here’s one:

We have two variables a and b. they are equal to eachother:

a = b - Two variables set equal to eachother
a + 5a = 5a + b - Add 5a to both sides
6a = 5a + b - Combine like terms
6a - 6b = 5a + b - 6b - Subtract 6b from each
6(a - b) = 5a + b - 6b - Factor
6(a - b) = 5a - 5b - Combine like terms
6(a - b) = 5(a - b) - Factor
6 = 5 - Divide by (a-b)

For the people that understand the basic logic, don’t ruin it for others!

item.title: Math joke
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

My country goes Algebra -> Geometry -> Algebra -> Geometry etc. until the third year of high school where we start trigonometry this year Maybe we’ll move on to Calculus next semester or something, but we’re obviously “not allowed to know top-secret information” so I don’t know yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Math joke
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:41, topic:365136”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=461339.msg3375973#msg3375973 date=1287615837]

[quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=461339.msg3375962#msg3375962 date=1287615492]

Actually there is no ‘limit’ to what classes you can take each year in high school, even if your district has a ‘curriculum’ (lolol). You can skip classes if you’re smart enough and can pass the final exam (lolol).

Also, you’re in trig/pre-calc so you obviously don’t get the joke.
[/quote]I never took summer school, and in middle school there WAS a limit to what classes I could take, so there was no way for me to pass the next years exams, and skip that year.

And I’m pretty sure anyone that isn’t blind can get the joke, it’s not exactly complicated.

Put an 8 into the equation and the answer is a rotated 8 (infinity)
Put a 5 into the equation and the answer is a rotated 5.
The definition of the mathematical forms used in the equation don’t seem to make any difference.

Wtf do mathematical forms have to do with this anything? And yes, I followed the curriculum in middle school then skipped 2 math levels in HS. So it’s possible. And I didn’t go to summer school.
[/quote]You are saying people can’t understand this because they don’t have a high enough math education correct? So I’m saying that the amount of mathematical education you have is irrelevant to understanding the joke.
What was your school MS curriculum, and what 2 years did you skip (classes)? I skipped two years going into MS (pre alg and math 7), then just kept going. It seems to me you only skipped 2 years as well, so I don’t see how can say skipping more than 2 is possible.

I skipped the whole MS curriculum. Took HS Geometry in 7th grade and started Trigonometry and Pre-Calculus in 8th grade. Didn’t finish the courses so I took Pre-Calculus again in 9th grade. Took AP Calculus BC in 10th grade. So it is possible. You just need to know the stuff and skip.[/quote]They didn’t give us any of those options… I asked for Geo in 7th grade (because I had taken algebra already) and they said that it wasn’t possible… I’m guessing our districts just run differently.

Read full topic

Also, you’re in trig/pre-calc so you obviously don’t get the joke.

And I’m pretty sure anyone that isn’t blind can get the joke, it’s not exactly complicated.

Put an 8 into the equation and the answer is a rotated 8 (infinity)
Put a 5 into the equation and the answer is a rotated 5.
The definition of the mathematical forms used in the equation don’t seem to make any difference.

Wtf do mathematical forms have to do with this anything? And yes, I followed the curriculum in middle school then skipped 2 math levels in HS. So it’s possible. And I didn’t go to summer school.
[/quote]You are saying people can’t understand this because they don’t have a high enough math education correct? So I’m saying that the amount of mathematical education you have is irrelevant to understanding the joke.
What was your school MS curriculum, and what 2 years did you skip (classes)? I skipped two years going into MS (pre alg and math 7), then just kept going. It seems to me you only skipped 2 years as well, so I don’t see how can say skipping more than 2 is possible.[/quote]
I skipped the whole MS curriculum. Took HS Geometry in 7th grade and started Trigonometry and Pre-Calculus in 8th grade. Didn’t finish the courses so I took Pre-Calculus again in 9th grade. Took AP Calculus BC in 10th grade. So it is possible. You just need to know the stuff and skip.

item.title: Math joke
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:33, topic:365136”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=461339.msg3375739#msg3375739 date=1287605525]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=461339.msg3375737#msg3375737 date=1287605255]

Pretty sure you don’t. Don’t you take like Pre-Algebra lolol.
[/quote]I took pre algebra in 5th grade? Atm I’m in Trig (for a few more weeks) then I go into Pre-Calc next semester.

So you’re in 8th grade at the moment? And how old are you?
[/quote]No, I’m in 10th grade. I’m 15. I had to take Algebra twice (6th and 7th) because you cannot go any higher than that in 7th grade.

My districts math courses are as follows (by semester)

[ul][li]Math 7 I[/li]
[li]Math 7 II[/li]
[li]Pre Algebra I[/li]
[li]Pre Algebra II[/li]
[li]Algebra I[/li]
[li]Algebra II[/li]
[li]Geometry I[/li]
[li]Geometry II[/li]
[li]Algebra III[/li]
[li]Algebra IV[/li]
[li]Trigonometry[/li]
[li]Pre-Calculus[/li]
[li]AP Calc I OR AP Stats II[/li]
[li]AP Calc II OR AP Stats II[/li][/ul]

In other words, I am two years excel, which is the highest my district allows. I was also in the ‘highly capable’ class during elementary school, which was always 1-2 years excel.[/quote]
Actually there is no ‘limit’ to what classes you can take each year in high school, even if your district has a ‘curriculum’ (lolol). You can skip classes if you’re smart enough and can pass the final exam (lolol).

Also, you’re in trig/pre-calc so you obviously don’t get the joke.

Read full topic

item.title: Math joke
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:32, topic:365136”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=461339.msg3375737#msg3375737 date=1287605255]

Pretty sure you don’t. Don’t you take like Pre-Algebra lolol.
[/quote]I took pre algebra in 5th grade? Atm I’m in Trig (for a few more weeks) then I go into Pre-Calc next semester.

So you’re in 8th grade at the moment? And how old are you?[/quote]No, I’m in 10th grade. I’m 15. I had to take Algebra twice (6th and 7th) because you cannot go any higher than that in 7th grade.

My districts math courses are as follows (by semester)

[ul][li]Math 7 I[/li]
[li]Math 7 II[/li]
[li]Pre Algebra I[/li]
[li]Pre Algebra II[/li]
[li]Algebra I[/li]
[li]Algebra II[/li]
[li]Geometry I[/li]
[li]Geometry II[/li]
[li]Algebra III[/li]
[li]Algebra IV[/li]
[li]Trigonometry[/li]
[li]Pre-Calculus[/li]
[li]AP Calc I OR AP Stats II[/li]
[li]AP Calc II OR AP Stats II[/li][/ul]

In other words, I am two years excel, which is the highest my district allows. I was also in the ‘highly capable’ class during elementary school, which was always 1-2 years excel.
